page.title: 01Cameley Vale Landscape
page.content: The landscape is mainly enclosed grass land,but woodland dominates the n.e. corner.The busy Bristol_Wells road runs north_south through the middle of the area.The roar of its traffic is soon muffled by the hedgerows of the beautiful Cam valley. The village of Temple Cloud is the only large settlement.The highest land is in the n.w where Rhaetic/Lias rises to 160m.To the n.e is a faulted block of Coal Measures which falls sharply to the Keuper marl in the south. Light industry is scattered through the e. of the area.In addition to information about industry and settlement in Cameley and Temple Cloud the following pages discuss recreation and local history,particularly the 'treasure' of Cameley Church and associations of the area with the Knights Templar.
